title: Twisted Paso 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: A tad shy on the nose, this offers dark fruit and earthy aromas. The flavors are woody with cedar and pencil shavings decorating the dark core of toast and charred fruit.

title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Barcelo Vermentino (Ile de Beauté)
description: This light, lively and spicy wine has ginger and nutmeg flavors backed by a mineral texture and crisp, citrusy acidity. It's ready to drink.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

title: Samuel Robert 2016 Perrydale Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: Produced from bled-off Pinot Noir juice, this is a robust, high alcohol rosé. It was put through partial malolactic fermentation and offers candy strawberry flavors up front, without much depth.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Samora Tinto Red (Tejo)
description: This wine is firm, with extracted tannins that give a bitter, dark-chocolate edge. Underneath await black fruits, acidity and a crisper edge. Drink from 2018.

title: Veglio 2015  Dolcetto d'Alba
description: Subdued baking spice and black-skinned fruit aromas mark the nose of this wine. The simple palate delivers blackberry and white pepper flavors and round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Coelho 2015 Zeitoun Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Some aspects of this wine have changed since the 2014 vintage: the alcohol is lower, and the exposure to new French oak (50%) is higher. There's something amiss, however. While light strawberry fruit and hints of chicken stock show on the palate, there's a foreshortening and feeling of dilution on the finish.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz, this wine has a good sense of structure, with  vibrant acidity and black-currant fruits. Touches of oak give a spicy edge to this juicy, fruity wine. Drink now.

title: Domaine Chavet 2015  Menetou-Salon
description: The wine is soft and ripe with gentle fruit and an attractive crisp aftertaste. A touch of vanilla and a smoky backdrop add to the flavors of this ready-to-drink wine.

title: Bougrier 2016 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: Crisply herbal in nature, this is a citrus fruit flavored wine. It's full of refreshing acidity, giving it a lively, bright character and an aftertaste that reinforces that laser focus.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Hat Trick Red (Lisboa)
description: Smooth and soft, this easygoing wine has spice, touches of wood from the barrel aging and a firm tannic core. It is balanced and ready to drink.

title: Casarena 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Floral aromas of blueberries blend with funky notes of coffee grounds on this unusual rendering of Cabernet Sauvignon. A hard palate hammers down with tannins, tasting of burnt coffee, green herbs, spiced plum and black currant. A minty flavors rises up on a finish that pulls up short.

title: Sutcliffe 2014 Bodysgallen Red (Colorado)
description: High toned cranberry and red cherry aromas mix with hot chili peppers on the nose. High acidity keeps the cranberry, pomegranate and cherry flavors bright on the palate, with spicy notes and taut tannins giving nuance. Black cherry, licorice and clove lead the spicy finish, which leans a bit hot.

title: Slater Run 2014 First Bridge Red (Virginia)
description: This Bordeaux-style blend has pretty aromas of cassis, fig, molasses and strawberry jam. The palate picks up some dried fruit and more molasses. This is an easy drinker, with a soft tannic structure and mild weight.

title: Tanner NV Silver Mine Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine is very floral for a red. It smells like roses and raspberries, tastes exuberantly fruity and has a juicy, lightly tannic texture.

title: Paul Buisse 2016 Château de Pocé Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: From vines on the north bank of the Loire, this wine is in a soft gentle style. With attractive fruit, it is light in texture with an attractive spring in its step. Ready to drink now.

title: Gen Del Alma 2014 Otra Piel Gualtallary Suelo Gen Fuerza Tranquila Red (Tupungato)
description: This blend of Cabernets Franc and Sauvignon includes Pinot Noir. The nose is floral and redolent of blueberry, red plum and licorice root. On the palate, it's an acid bomb, with sour flavors of plum and red currant. A pinching, drawing finish is lively and fresh.
designation: Otra Piel Gualtallary Suelo Gen Fuerza Tranquila

title: Haak 2014 Malbec (Texas High Plains)
description: Cocoa powder, anise and cowhide aromas lead, with hints of fresh currants. Juicy cherry and ripe raspberry are appealing on the palate, paving the way for sweet baking spices and vanilla. The tannins are disjointed from this soft-structured, fruit-forward offering. The lack of acidity is most apparent on the finish, which shows overripe cherry and hints of clove.

title: Horton 2016 Vidal Blanc (Virginia)
description: Fresh tropical aromas of lychee, mango, honeydew and orange blossom show on the nose. These notes carry to the palate and mix with an herbaceous quality. Soft and round in mouthfeel, this Vidal ends on a savory note.

title: Hubert Brochard 2015 Tradition  (Sancerre)
description: A yellow-fruit interpretation of Sauvignon Blanc, meaning it is ripe, full and smooth. Of course there is acidity but it is calm and soft. The fruit dominates this rich wine that is ready to drink.

title: Hunky Dory 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Made from certified organic fruit, this impressively dark and tannic bottling is essentially the second wine of Huia. Dark cherries and vanilla finish firm. Drink it now with grilled meats, or hold it until 2018–2019 and see how it develops in the cellar.

title: Early Mountain 2014 Novum Red (Virginia)
description: This Bordeaux-style blend is fresh, showing aromas of red currant, tomato leaf, licorice and mint. These notes continue onto the palate along with shots of tart cranberry. This is zippy and enjoyable but needs a little more tannic structure to balance.

title: Paraduxx 2014 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick full-bodied commingling of Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel and Merlot. Soy, plum sauce and brambly blackberry rise on the palate. The grapes are a mix of mountain-grown and valley floor.

title: Monmousseau 2016 Justin Monmousseau Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: While there is a herbal character to this wine, its main interest is in the ripe orange and apricot fruits. They cut easily into the acidity and the mineral edge of this attractive ready-to-drink wine.

title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Fonte da Serrana Branco White (Alentejano)
description: Antão Vaz and Arinto, two classic white varieties of Alentejo, are blended into this simple, fruity wine. Its acidity and citrus fruitiness have been given weight by lees stirring. The wine is crisp and lively, ready to drink now.

title: Philippe Viallet 2016 Savoie Rosé (Vin de Savoie)
description: Made from 100% Gamay, this is a crisp wine with attractive acidity, red currant fruit and a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Evel Branco White (Douro)
description: Smooth, creamy and lightly perfumed, this wine is packed with apple, pear and yellow fruit flavors that are topped with acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.

title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Rosé (Douro)
description: Produced from 100% Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp, dry wine, full of red-currant fruits and with a tang of citrus. This attractive wine is ready to drink.

title: Paris-Simoneau 2016 Antoine Simoneau Cuvée AS Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This tangy wine is crisp while also fruity. With its hints of herbal flavors along with green plum and apples, it is a juicy wine that is ready to drink now.

title: Paris-Simoneau 2016 Antoine Simoneau Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This is a stylish attractive wine. It has an herbal touch although it is more about delicious bright fruit. Citrus and crisp apples dominate, laced with acidity. This refreshing wine is ready to drink now.

title: Mirassou 2015 Moscato (California)
description: A spritzy texture livens up this sugary light-bodied wine that smells like honeydew melons and tastes like a sweet citrus sorbet.
